intro: Marsdenia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed Marsdenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. The plant contains milky sap and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
